law.catch_line: A family may be eligible for assistance under this subtitle only if the family includes:...

section.section:
A family may be eligible for assistance under this subtitle only if the family includes:
a minor child who resides with a custodial parent or other adult caretaker who is a relative of the child; or
a pregnant individual.
An individual may not be required to meet the work activity requirement under subsection (a)(2)(iv) of this section if the individual is exempt under criteria the Secretary establishes.

The criteria shall include exemptions for:
adults who are required to care for a child who is a recipient under the age of 1 year; and
subject to paragraph (3) of this subsection, adults and children who are recipients and who are severely disabled.

An individual's exemption because of severe disability is limited to 12 months unless:
the individual applies for Supplemental Security Income; and
the application is approved, pending, or on appeal.

text.section:
Subject to the State budget, a legal immigrant is entitled to assistance under this subtitle if the immigrant:
meets FIP eligibility requirements under this subtitle and any other requirements imposed by the State; and
arrived in the United States before August 22, 1996; or
arrived in the United States on or after August 22, 1996 and is not eligible for federally funded cash assistance.
